page.title: 17INEQUALITY ERDINGTON
page.content: We did a survey to people's attitudes to the role of men and women at home. We found the following results: Mothers usually do the housework at home especially the cleaning. Shopping is nearly always done by the mothers although children help too. Virtually all work on the car is done by men with sons helping occasionally. It was found to be rare that a daughter helped Dad with the car. Dads tend to take responsibility for the garden whilst Mum takes car of the washing. Most children make their own beds but if not it is normally Mum who does this. Things may be changing a little, for instance more Dads seem to be taking responsibility for cooking and often finance is worked out jointly. Things may be changing but Mums and Dads seem to have divided up the tasks in a similar way to their parents.
